radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in size and echotexture. Complex hypoechoic lesion measuring 7 mm in diameter in the right lobe, may represent an atypical hemangioma. Gallbladder is distended with mural thickening and edema, several non-obstructing stones in the gallbladder body, and a 16 mm obstructing stone in the cystic duct. Small amount of pericholecystic fluid. Common bile duct dilated to 7 mm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression noted from prior CT indicating a hyperdense lesion to a complex hypoechoic lesion in the current ultrasound.
